main event: On September 17, 1956, an unidentified flying object (UFO) was observed and reported by three civilians in New Castle, Delaware. The object was described as a silver or white light with jagged edges, about the size of a half dollar or a small grapefruit. It was seen stationary in the north-northeast (NNE) at a 30-degree elevation before disappearing suddenly in a great burst of speed.
interesting points: The UFO was observed and reported by three civilians from different locations in the New Castle area.
Although they disagreed on the shape of the object, they all agreed on its approximate size, color, and manner of disappearance.
The object was described as a very bright light, silver or white in color, with jagged edges and projections at the top, bottom, and sides.
It was seen stationary in the NNE at a 30-degree elevation before disappearing suddenly in a great burst of speed.
The total length of observation of the UFO ranged from three to thirteen minutes.
sighted object: Unidentified flying object (described as a silver or white light with jagged edges)
witnesses: Three civilians from different locations in the New Castle area
